inputs.name: Absolute
inputs.description: A boolean. If set it indicates that the warps in --warp should be interpreted as absolute, provided that it is not created by fnirt (which always uses relative warps). if set it also indicates that the output --out should be absolute.

inputs.name: Args
inputs.description: A string. Additional parameters to the command.

inputs.name: Environ
inputs.description: A dictionary with keys which are a value of type 'str' and with values which are a value of type 'str'. Environment variables.

inputs.name: Ignore exception
inputs.description: A boolean. Print an error message instead of throwing an exception in case the interface fails to run.

inputs.name: Inverse warp
inputs.description: A file name. Name of output file, containing warps that are the "reverse" of those in --warp. this will be a field-file (rather than a file of spline coefficients), and it will have any affine component included as part of the displacements.

inputs.name: Jacobian max
inputs.description: A float. Maximum acceptable jacobian value for constraint (default 100.0).

inputs.name: Jacobian min
inputs.description: A float. Minimum acceptable jacobian value for constraint (default 0.01).

inputs.name: Niter
inputs.description: An integer (int or long). Determines how many iterations of the gradient-descent search that should be run.

inputs.name: Noconstraint
inputs.description: A boolean. Do not apply jacobian constraint.

inputs.name: Output type
inputs.description: 'nifti_pair' or 'nifti_pair_gz' or 'nifti_gz' or 'nifti'. Fsl output type.

inputs.name: Reference
inputs.description: An existing file name. Name of a file in target space. note that the target space is now different from the target space that was used to create the --warp file. it would typically be the file that was specified with the --in argument when running fnirt.

inputs.name: Relative
inputs.description: A boolean. If set it indicates that the warps in --warp should be interpreted as relative. i.e. the values in --warp are displacements from the coordinates in the --ref space. if set it also indicates that the output --out should be relative.

inputs.name: Terminal output
inputs.description: 'stream' or 'allatonce' or 'file' or 'none'. Control terminal output: `stream` - displays to terminal immediately (default), `allatonce` - waits till command is finished to display output, `file` - writes output to file, `none` - output is ignored.

inputs.name: Warp
inputs.description: An existing file name. Name of file containing warp-coefficients/fields. this would typically be the output from the --cout switch of fnirt (but can also use fields, like the output from --fout).

name: InvWarp
description: InvWarp, as implemented in Nipype (module: nipype.interfaces.fsl, interface: InvWarp).
